TopicTitle: [MOAR MUSIC] I honestly can't ask for more...except...

Articles.Content:
I *love* KSP. Its almost perfect, and what with the upcoming features being mentioned in the blurb, I am sooo happy.

Except.

PLEASE!

Can we have just a bit more music?

I don't know how many hours I have spent in KSP but pleeeease just a few more minutes of different music, I can't stand the same tunes any more!

I mean, its nice, and well-made made, but....please D:

Bum-Bum-Bum,Bum. Bum. Bah-Bum-Bum-Bum-Bum, Bum.

Baaaah, Bum-daBum-Bum,Bum,Bum-daBum-Bum.....

:confused:

(Oh, and buttons to travel to each section of the space centre FROM each other section of the space centre would be nice too )

Edited November 3, 2014 by p1t1o

I feel you. I play on mute now. Heard it once, heard it all.

(I would also like this being able to go to the different buildings. Especially, if nothing else, to be able to go to the Tracking Station from spacecraft instead of going to the Space Center and then the Tracking Station.)

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/88869-KSP-Plugin-Songs!-(Current-Song-MINMUS)

Squad is willing to integrate mods, They should integrate UpsilonAerospace's music tracks (If that's ok with Upsilon).

The Duna track is really beautiful:
All the KSP music is by Kevin MacLeod, a lot of his other stuff fits well within KSP if you want to keep the same style.

All the KSP music is by Kevin MacLeod, a lot of his other stuff fits well within KSP if you want to keep the same style.

Ooh, I found the one that Danny2462 uses ALL THE TIME!

"Call to Adventure" by that author.

All the KSP music is by Kevin MacLeod, a lot of his other stuff fits well within KSP if you want to keep the same style.

Is this a joke?
as long as we're talking sound, I think integration of chatterer would also be pretty cool

as long as we're talking sound, I think integration of chatterer would also be pretty cool

^^This^^

I used to play with Chatterer installed. I had all the settings turned up so that it would play SSTV and voices much more frequently than average, just for fun.

@SQUAD: Please? Just a few beeps or whatever? .-.

as long as we're talking sound, I think integration of chatterer would also be pretty cool

As long as it can be turned off. I tried it and found it incredibly annoying.

I *love* KSP. Its almost perfect, and what with the upcoming features being mentioned in the blurb, I am sooo happy.

Except.

PLEASE!

Can we have just a bit more music?

I don't know how many hours I have spent in KSP but pleeeease just a few more minutes of different music, I can't stand the same tunes any more!

I mean, its nice, and well-made made, but....please D:

Bum-Bum-Bum,Bum. Bum. Bah-Bum-Bum-Bum-Bum, Bum.

Baaaah, Bum-daBum-Bum,Bum,Bum-daBum-Bum.....

:confused:

(Oh, and buttons to travel to each section of the space centre FROM each other section of the space centre would be nice too )

Bring up your Steam web browser, navigate to Pandora, type in "King Crimson" for all your 1960's space music needs.

as long as we're talking sound, i think integration of chatterer would also be pretty cool

definitely (Thats weird, it wouldn't let me have that in all-caps...flame-war suppression?)

as long as we're talking sound, I think integration of chatterer would also be pretty cool

Something like chatter would be great for Kerbal Tasks... so as well random chatter for housekeeping, there could be specific chatter as a cue that Kerbals doing stuff as part of a mission, or training cues like reading off elevation during assent. Yet still in chatter Kerbal speak so it's not telling you what to do just that there is something to do.

Chaterer can be nice at times but got pretty fast anoying to me, so pls put in a turn

The music thing is true. As much as I like the soundtrack that is implemented,.there simply aren't enough tracks. I can't enjoy it longer than half an hour

I usually have some old jazz or swing from my own playlists in the background now. Although "fly me to the mun" might be too much of a clishe

Get the Neon Genesis Evangelion soundtrack. They used a different version of Fly Me To The Moon Ã¢â‚¬â€¹over the closing credits of each episode.

SQUAD should seriously consider getting in contact with Jonathan Franklin (I don't know his username on the forums). He's dedicating a symphony to Kerbal Space Program! He usually writes film scores, but is working on this for fun! You can hear his first movement at https://soundcloud.com/jfranklincomposer/symphony-of-the-kerbals-oveture.

I'm sure there are at least half-a-dozen composers who would love to see their work added to the official soundtracks.
